thread.title: Man charged with 1st-degree murder in death of Hudson Bay, Sask. woman | Globalnews.ca
thread.title_full: Man charged with 1st-degree murder in death of Hudson Bay, Sask. woman | Globalnews.ca

author: Thomas Piller
title: Man charged with 1st-degree murder in death of Hudson Bay, Sask. woman | Globalnews.ca
text:
February 5, 2017 11:46 am Updated: February 5, 2017 11:47 am Man charged with 1st-degree murder in death of Hudson Bay, Sask. woman By Thomas Piller Online Producer Global News 
RCMP have charged a man with first-degree murder in the death of a 27-year-old woman in Hudson Bay, Sask. Google Maps What is this? 
Sponsored content is written by Global News' editorial staff without any editorial influence by the sponsor. If you'd like to learn more... X What is this? 
Sponsored content is written by Global News' without any editorial influence by the sponsor. If you'd like to learn more... - Listen 
Saskatchewan RCMP say a man has been charged in the death of a 27-year-old woman in Hudson Bay. 
At 5 p.m. CT on Friday, police received a complaint that a woman had been shot at a residence on Hudson Street in the town of Hudson Bay, Sask. 
Upon arrival, emergency personnel pronounced Stacie Lewis, 27, dead at the scene. 
READ MORE: RCMP lay 2nd-degree murder charge in death of man found by Duck Lake, Sask. 
RCMP officials said a person of interest was immediately identified and arrested without incident. 
Steven Lee Lewis, 32, has been charged with one count of first-degree murder. He has been remanded into custody and is scheduled to appear in Melfort provincial court on Feb. 7. 
RCMP officials said the accused and victim were known to each other. Both are from Hudson Bay. 
The investigation is ongoing. 
Hudson Bay is approximately 300 kilometres east of Saskatoon. Â© 2017 Global News, a division of Corus Entertainment Inc.
